notes: Working titles for this story were The Spidermen, The Insect-Men and The Macras.
This story is the first to use a new title sequence incorporating an image of Patrick Troughton's face.
All four episodes are missing from the BBC Archives, though some clips on 16mm black & white film and 8mm cine film survive.
The audio of the entire story is available.
The Macra returned to Doctor Who forty years later in Gridlock, making it the third longest interval between consecutive appearances by a character or alien race in franchise history.

in_universe_mythology: The ancestors of the colony came from Earth many centuries ago.
real_world_cultural_references: The song "Chromophone Band" is playing when the Doctor and his companions arrive at the colony and when the Macra are defeated.

continuity_notes: This story takes place almost immediately after The Moonbase — the TARDIS crew witnessed the Macra claw on the time scanner in the previous serial.

plot.plot_summary: When the Second Doctor, Ben, Polly and Jamie visit a human colony that appears to be one big holiday camp, they think they have come across a truly happy place. Yet a shadowy presence soon makes them realise that the surface contentment is carefully controlled. The colony's inhabitants have been brainwashed by giant, crab-like creatures — the Macra. Insidious propaganda, broadcast by the Controller, forces the humans to mine a gas that is essential for the Macra to survive, but fatal to them. The Doctor and his team are up against it, particularly when Ben falls under the influence of the Macra. Can they destroy the gas pumping equipment and get rid of the Macra for good?
